content.prompt: Which of the following accurately compares how party systems affect citizen participation?

choices.label: In China, support for alternatives to the Chinese Communist Party is strongly discouraged by the state, while in the United Kingdom, the two major parties have undermined citizen participation.
In Russia, a dominant party discourages participation except in support of the dominant party, while in Mexico, competitive national elections have encouraged citizen participation.
In Iran, free and fair elections have occurred despite a lack of formal parties, while in Nigeria, a two-party system discourages citizen participation.
In the United Kingdom, there are no political parties that discourage participation, while in Iran, a dominant-party system increases participation.

unit.text: 4: Party and Electoral Systems and Citizen Organizations

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
